ground_truth: Next to a faded diorama of the nativity scene, a man deftly rolls an engraved silver Zippo back and forth over his nicotine-stained fingers. Behind the counter, Percy Walker, a black man in his sixties, is cooking with spectacular one-handed dexterity. A stunning sixteen-year-old girl with dyed-black hair and a piercing or three leans seductively over the jukebox, swaying gently to the music. Her headband, doubling as a mini-skirt, reveals her knock-out figure, leaving little to the imagination. Watching from a booth across the diner is a conservatively dressed suburban couple, Sandra and Howard Anderson. The girl, Audrey Anderson, turns to Howard with a caustic smile and then returns to the jukebox, while Percy discreetly watches the exchange from behind the counter. Howard turns back to his wife with a rigid smile. Outside, the noontime sun bakes the highway slicing through the barren country as a black Cadillac Escalade blazes a path, heavy beats thundering from within. Kyle Williams, handsome and in his late twenties with a thug style, passes a weathered road sign and his expression suggests this is not good news. He grabs a cell phone from the passenger seat and spots a truck stop diner up ahead. The Escalade pulls off the highway to the old gas pumps. Kyle gets out, surveying the grease stains and rusty car parts littering the ground, and behind the place, the Silverstream trailer is visible where Jeep was earlier. Kyle grabs a crumpled hand-drawn map from the front seat and flattens it on the car roof. A woman lets out a long slow exhale, considers Kyle, then pulls out a cigarette, lights it off the end of hers, and hands it to him. Kyle takes a drag and pulls out his map again. Charlie quickly hides her cigarette behind her back as Jeep nods uncertainly, eyes Kyle, then shuffles away out of sight. Bob steps off a chair, turns to Kyle, about to respond when Howard approaches, unaware he's interrupting. Bob's expression darkens at the news, and Jeep walks toward the gas pumps, with Bob right alongside him, not giving up. Jeep stiffens, turns to his father, and Bob gives him a hard stare. Jeep looks at his father, his words hanging heavily in the air. Bob then walks back into the diner. Jeep is about to return to the garage when he notices ominous dark clouds on the southern horizon like a living wall.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution

Behind the counter, Percy Walker, a black gentleman in his sixties, is cooking with spectacular one-handed agility. Kyle Williams, attractive and in his late twenties with a thug style, passes a weathered road sign and his expression suggests this is not good news. He grabs a cell phone from the passenger seat and spots a truck stop diner up ahead. The Escalade pulls off the highway to the old gas pumps. Kyle gets out, surveying the grease smudges and rusty car parts cluttering the ground, and behind the place, the Silverstream trailer is visible where Jeep was earlier. Kyle grabs a crumpled hand-drawn chart from the front seat and flattens it on the car roof. A woman lets out a long slow exhale, considers Kyle, then pulls out a cigarette, ignites it off the end of hers, and hands it to him. Kyle takes a drag and pulls out his chart again. Charlie quickly hides her cigarette behind her back as Jeep nods uncertainly, eyes Kyle, then shuffles away out of sight. Bob steps off a chair, turns to Kyle, about to respond when Howard approaches, unaware he's interrupting. Bob's expression darkens at the news, and Jeep ambles toward the gas pumps, with Bob right alongside him, not giving up. Jeep stiffens, turns to his father, and Bob gives him a hard look. Jeep gazes at his father, his words hanging heavily in the air. Bob then walks back into the diner. Jeep is about to return to the garage when he notices ominous dark clouds on the southern horizon like a living wall.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: Next to a faded diorama of the nativity scene, an engraved silver Zippo is deftly rolled back and forth over nicotine-stained fingers by a man. Behind the counter, Percy Walker, a black man in his sixties, is using spectacular one-handed dexterity to cook. A stunning sixteen-year-old girl with dyed-black hair and a piercing or three seduces the jukebox by leaning over it, swaying gently to the music. Her headband, doubling as a mini-skirt, reveals her knock-out figure, leaving little to the imagination. Watching from a booth across the diner, a conservatively dressed suburban couple, Sandra and Howard Anderson, observe. Audrey Anderson, the girl, turns to Howard with a caustic smile before returning to the jukebox, while the exchange is discreetly watched by Percy from behind the counter. Howard directs a rigid smile at his wife. Outside, the noontime sun bakes the highway slicing through the barren country as a path is blazed by a black Cadillac Escalade, with heavy beats thundering from within. Kyle Williams, handsome and in his late twenties with a thug style, passes a weathered road sign, and his expression suggests that bad news is perceived by him. From the passenger seat, a cell phone is grabbed by him and a truck stop diner is spotted up ahead. The highway is exited by the Escalade to the old gas pumps. The ground, littered with grease stains and rusty car parts, is surveyed by Kyle as he gets out, and behind the place, the Silverstream trailer is visible where Jeep was earlier. A crumpled hand-drawn map is grabbed from the front seat by Kyle and flattened on the car roof. A long slow exhale is let out by a woman, who considers Kyle, then pulls out a cigarette, lights it off the end of hers, and hands it to him. A drag is taken by Kyle, and his map is pulled out again. Charlie quickly hides her cigarette behind her back, and Jeep, uncertainly watching with eyes on Kyle, then shuffles out of sight. A chair is stepped off by Bob, who turns to Kyle, about to respond when Howard approaches, unaware he's interrupting. At the news, Bob's expression darkens, and toward the gas pumps walks Jeep, with Bob right alongside him, refusing to give up. Jeep stiffens, turning to his father, and Bob gives him a hard stare. Bob is looked at by Jeep, his words hanging heavily in the air. Bob then returns to the diner. The garage is about to be returned to by Jeep when ominous dark clouds are noticed on the southern horizon like a living wall.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Next to a worn nativity scene diorama, a man deftly rolls an engraved silver Zippo over his nicotine-stained fingers. Percy Walker, in his sixties, cooks with remarkable one-handed skill behind the counter. A striking sixteen-year-old girl with dyed-black hair and piercings leans over the jukebox, gently swaying. Sporting a mini-skirt headband, her stunning figure is evident. Observing from a booth is a conservatively dressed suburban couple, Sandra and Howard Anderson. The girl, Audrey, turns to Howard with a caustic smile, then returns to the jukebox as Percy discreetly observes. Howard faces his wife with a stiff smile. Outside, the noontime sun bakes the highway cutting through barren land as a black Cadillac Escalade speeds by, thumping with heavy beats. Kyle Williams, handsome, in his late twenties with a thug style, passes a weathered road sign, clearly displeased. He grabs a cell phone and spots a truck stop diner ahead. The Escalade pulls into gas pumps. Kyle exits, noting grease stains and rusty car parts, with a Silverstream trailer visible behind where Jeep was earlier. Kyle flattens a crumpled hand-drawn map on the roof. A woman lets out a slow exhale, considers Kyle, lights a cigarette, and hands it to him. Kyle takes a drag, pulls out his map again. Charlie hides her cigarette as Jeep eyes Kyle and shuffles away. Bob steps off a chair, about to speak to Kyle when Howard arrives, interrupting. Bob's expression darkens, Jeep heads to the pumps, with Bob following closely, persistent. Jeep stiffens, meets his father's hard stare, words hanging heavily. Bob returns to the diner. Jeep heads back to the garage, noticing ominous dark clouds on the southern horizon like a living wall.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Next to a faded nativity diorama, a man rolls a silver Zippo over nicotine-stained fingers. Percy Walker, a sixty-something black man, cooks behind the counter with skill. A stunning sixteen-year-old with dyed-black hair sways over the jukebox in a scanty headband-skirt, captivating a conservatively dressed suburban couple, Sandra and Howard Anderson. Audrey Anderson smiles caustically at Howard and returns to the jukebox as Percy observes discreetly. The noontime sun bakes the highway, where a black Cadillac Escalade booms past, driven by the thug-styled Kyle Williams. His expression grows grim at a road sign, and he grabs his cell phone, spotting a distant truck stop diner. The Escalade parks at old gas pumps as Kyle examines the littered ground and a Silverstream trailer. He flattens a crumpled map on the car roof, taking a cigarette offered by a woman. Kyle draws on it, checks his map while Charlie hides her cigarette and Jeep uneasily observes Kyle before shuffling off. Bob steps down, turns to Kyle as Howard interrupts. Bob darkens at the news, accompanies Jeep to the pumps, glaring at him. Jeep pauses, noting dark clouds on the southern horizon.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: Next to a weathered, faded diorama depicting the nativity scene, a man skillfully rolls an intricately engraved silver Zippo lighter back and forth over his nicotine-stained fingers with practiced ease. Positioned behind the counter is Percy Walker, a black man in his sixties who demonstrates remarkable one-handed dexterity as he cooks. Nearby, a breathtaking sixteen-year-old girl, whose hair is dyed black and who sports a piercing or three, leans alluringly over the jukebox, gently swaying to the rhythm of the music. Her attire includes a headband that doubles as a mini-skirt, showcasing her striking figure and leaving little to the imagination. Observing the scene from a booth across the diner is a conservatively dressed suburban couple named Sandra and Howard Anderson. The girl, Audrey Anderson, directs a caustic smile at Howard before returning her attention to the jukebox. Meanwhile, Percy discreetly watches the interaction from his post behind the counter. Howard, with a rigid smile, turns back to his wife. Outside, the noontime sun relentlessly bakes the highway, which slices through the desolate, barren country landscape as a black Cadillac Escalade speeds by, with heavy beats thumping loudly from within. Driving the vehicle is Kyle Williams, a handsome man in his late twenties who embodies a thug style. As he passes a weathered road sign, his expression suggests the news it bears is not particularly welcome. Reaching for a cell phone in the passenger seat, he spots a truck stop diner coming into view and decides to pull the Escalade off the highway to the old gas pumps. Exiting the vehicle, Kyle surveys the grease stains and rusty car parts scattered across the ground. Behind the establishment, the Silverstream trailer is visible, where Jeep was seen earlier. Kyle retrieves a crumpled, hand-drawn map from the front seat, flattening it on the roof of the car. A woman nearby exhales slowly and thoughtfully, considering Kyle before lighting a cigarette from the end of her own, handing it to him. Kyle takes a drag, then pulls out his map again. Charlie quickly conceals her cigarette behind her back when Jeep nods uncertainly, regards Kyle, and shuffles away out of sight. Bob steps down from a chair, preparing to respond to Kyle, but is interrupted as Howard approaches, unaware of the disruption. Bob’s expression darkens upon hearing the news, and Jeep walks toward the gas pumps with Bob steadfastly beside him, refusing to relent. Jeep stiffens, turns to face his father as Bob fixes him with a stern stare. The weight of Jeep's unsaid words hangs heavily in the air between them. Bob eventually heads back into the diner. Jeep is about to make his way back to the garage when he notices ominous, dark clouds gathering on the southern horizon, looming like a living, menacing wall.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: Adjacent to an old, weathered, and faded diorama that artistically depicts the nativity scene, a man adeptly rolls a meticulously and intricately engraved silver Zippo lighter back and forth over his nicotine-stained fingers with a practiced and effortless ease. Positioned securely behind the counter is Percy Walker, a well-seasoned black man in his sixties, who showcases his remarkable and impressive one-handed dexterity as he skillfully cooks. Not far away, there is an incredibly striking sixteen-year-old girl, her hair dyed a deep black, and she sports a piercing or perhaps even three. She alluringly leans over the jukebox, gently swaying back and forth to the rhythm of the music playing. Her outfit includes a headband that ingeniously doubles as a mini-skirt, highlighting her striking figure and leaving very little to the imagination. Watching this scene unfold from a booth across the diner is a conservatively dressed suburban couple named Sandra and Howard Anderson. The girl, known as Audrey Anderson, directs a caustic smile at Howard before promptly returning her divided attention to the jukebox. Meanwhile, Percy observes the interaction discreetly from his position behind the counter. Howard, wearing a rigid and forced smile, turns his attention back to his wife. Outside the diner, the relentless noontime sun bakes the highway unmercifully, which slices through the desolate and barren country landscape as a black Cadillac Escalade zips by with heavy, thumping beats resonating loudly from within. Driving the vehicle is Kyle Williams, a strikingly handsome man in his late twenties who exudes a thug style. As he passes a worn and weathered road sign, his expression suggests that the news it bears is not particularly welcome. Reaching for a cell phone on the passenger seat, he notices a truck stop diner coming into view and makes the decision to pull the Escalade off the highway towards the old gas pumps. As Kyle exits the vehicle, he surveys the scattered grease stains and rusty car parts littering the ground. Behind the establishment, the Silverstream trailer is visible, where Jeep was seen earlier. Kyle retrieves a crumpled, hand-drawn map from the front seat, flattening it on the car roof to examine it more closely. A woman nearby exhales slowly and thoughtfully, considering Kyle carefully before lighting a cigarette from the end of her own and handing it to him. Kyle accepts it, takes a drag, then pulls out his map again to scrutinize it. Charlie quickly conceals her cigarette behind her back when Jeep nods uncertainly, regards Kyle, and shuffles away out of sight. Bob steps down from his chair, preparing to respond to Kyle, but he is interrupted as Howard approaches, unaware of the disruption he causes. Bob’s expression darkens considerably upon hearing the news, and Jeep walks toward the gas pumps with Bob steadfastly beside him, refusing to relent in his stance. Jeep stiffens as he turns to face his father while Bob fixes him with a stern stare. The weight of Jeep's unsaid words hangs heavily in the tense air between them. Eventually, Bob heads back into the diner. Jeep is about to make his way back to the garage when he notices ominously dark clouds gathering on the southern horizon, looming like a living, menacing wall.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Next to a faded diorama of the nativity scene, a man deftly manipulates an engraved silver Zippo, rolling it back and forth over his nicotine-stained fingers with practiced ease, each movement smooth and deliberate. Behind the counter, Percy Walker, a black man in his sixties, demonstrates his remarkable cooking skills, handling his tools with spectacular one-handed dexterity, every flip and turn of food precise. Across the diner, a stunning sixteen-year-old girl with dyed-black hair and a couple of piercings leans over the jukebox with a seductive air, her body swaying gently to the rhythm of the music playing from the machine. Her headband, creatively repurposed as a mini-skirt, barely conceals her impressive figure, leaving little to the imagination as she moves. Observing this scene from a nearby booth, a conservatively dressed suburban couple, Sandra and Howard Anderson, watch intently. The girl, known as Audrey Anderson, shifts her gaze to Howard, offering a caustic smile before returning her attention to the jukebox. Percy, ever observant, discreetly watches this brief exchange from his position behind the counter. Howard turns back to his wife, his smile tight and composed, masking any discomfort. Meanwhile, outside, the noontime sun mercilessly bakes the highway slicing through the barren landscape, its heat intensifying as a black Cadillac Escalade races down the road, its windows vibrating with heavy beats thundering from within the vehicle. Inside, Kyle Williams, a handsome man in his late twenties exuding a thug style, drives with a focused expression, noting with mild concern a weathered road sign that indicates something unwelcome. As he adjusts his grip on the steering wheel, he reaches over to grab a cell phone from the passenger seat, his eyes scanning the horizon until he spots a truck stop diner looming ahead. Deciding to take a break, the Escalade veers off the highway and glides to a stop by the timeworn gas pumps. Kyle exits the vehicle, taking in the scene around him, his eyes surveying the grease stains and the rusty car parts littering the ground, and he notices the Silverstream trailer parked behind the establishment, recalling its presence from earlier visits. Retrieving a crumpled hand-drawn map from the front seat, Kyle smooths it out on the roof of his car, scrutinizing it closely. As he does so, a woman observes him, releases a long and deliberate exhale, and after a moment of consideration, pulls out a cigarette, lighting it with the end of her own before extending it to Kyle. He accepts it, takes a deep drag, and then unfolds his map again for another inspection. Nearby, Charlie, with quick reflexes, hides her cigarette behind her back as Jeep, watching Kyle with a mix of uncertainty and curiosity, nods slightly before shuffling away, disappearing from sight. Meanwhile, Bob steps off a chair, turning to Kyle, prepared to engage in conversation, when Howard approaches the scene, oblivious to the fact that he is interrupting something important. Bob's expression shifts to irritation as he receives unwelcome news, and Jeep begins walking toward the gas pumps with Bob accompanying him, undeterred by the interruption. Observing his father's hard stare, Jeep stiffens momentarily, his own gaze fixed on Bob, as unsaid words hang heavily between them. Their interaction concludes as Bob abruptly turns and heads back into the diner. Left standing, Jeep is about to make his way back to the garage when he pauses, his attention drawn to the southern horizon where ominous dark clouds gather and swirl, forming a living wall that seems to threaten the quiet stillness of the land.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Next to a faded nativity scene diorama, a man skillfully rolls a silver Zippo across his nicotine-stained fingers. Behind the counter, Percy Walker, a black man in his sixties, showcases remarkable one-handed cooking skills. Nearby, a striking sixteen-year-old with dyed-black hair and piercings sways seductively to the jukebox music, her headband serving as a mini-skirt that accentuates her figure. Observing from a booth, Sandra and Howard Anderson—a conservative suburban couple—watch as their daughter, Audrey, throws a caustic smile at Howard before turning back to the jukebox. Percy discreetly observes their interaction. Outside, the noontime sun blazes over the highway as a black Cadillac Escalade approaches, driven by Kyle Williams, a handsome, thug-styled man in his late twenties. Passing a weathered sign, Kyle’s expression reveals concern; he grabs his phone and spots an approaching truck stop diner. The Escalade pulls in, and Kyle surveys the greasy, rusted surroundings, noting a Silverstream trailer where Jeep was seen earlier. Flattening a crumpled map on the car roof, a woman hands Kyle a lit cigarette, and he takes a drag while referring to his map again. Charlie conceals her cigarette as Jeep exchanges wary glances with Kyle before shuffling away. Bob, stepping off a chair, turns to Kyle just as Howard unknowingly interrupts. Bob’s expression darkens at the news, and as Jeep moves towards the gas pumps with Bob, Jeep stiffens at his father’s hard stare. Bob then returns to the diner, while Jeep, noticing ominous dark clouds on the southern horizon, hesitates before heading back to the garage.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Next to a faded diorama of the nativity scene, a representation often displayed during the Christmas season symbolizing the birth of Jesus Christ, a man deftly rolls an engraved silver Zippo, a brand famous for its windproof lighters and a collector's favorite, back and forth over his nicotine-stained fingers. Behind the counter, Percy Walker, a black man in his sixties known for his history as a professional chef on the Southern cooking circuit, is cooking with spectacular one-handed dexterity. A stunning sixteen-year-old girl with dyed-black hair and a piercing or three leans seductively over the jukebox, an iconic symbol of American diners that plays records upon request, swaying gently to the music. Her headband, doubling as a mini-skirt, reveals her knock-out figure, leaving little to the imagination. Watching from a booth across the diner is a conservatively dressed suburban couple, Sandra and Howard Anderson, who are regulars known for their traditional values and reserved demeanor. The girl, Audrey Anderson, turns to Howard with a caustic smile, suggesting a complicated family dynamic, and then returns to the jukebox, while Percy discreetly watches the exchange from behind the counter. Howard turns back to his wife with a rigid smile that belies his discomfort. Outside, the noontime sun bakes the highway, a crucial artery for travelers in this otherwise isolated region, slicing through the barren country as a black Cadillac Escalade, a luxury SUV often associated with wealth and power, blazes a path, heavy beats thundering from within. Kyle Williams, handsome and in his late twenties with a thug style, indicating a possible involvement in underground activities, passes a weathered road sign and his expression suggests this is not good news. He grabs a cell phone from the passenger seat and spots a truck stop diner up ahead, a haven for weary travelers. The Escalade pulls off the highway to the old gas pumps sourced from a bygone era. Kyle gets out, surveying the grease stains and rusty car parts littering the ground, remnants of the diner's mechanical past, and behind the place, the Silverstream trailer is visible where Jeep, his longtime associate, was earlier. Kyle grabs a crumpled hand-drawn map, potentially leading to hidden opportunities or dangers, from the front seat and flattens it on the car roof. A woman lets out a long slow exhale, considers Kyle with the familiarity of shared history, then pulls out a cigarette, lights it off the end of hers, and hands it to him. Kyle takes a drag and pulls out his map again. Charlie quickly hides her cigarette behind her back as Jeep, known for his cautious nature, nods uncertainly, eyes Kyle, then shuffles away out of sight. Bob steps off a chair, turns to Kyle, about to respond when Howard approaches, unaware he's interrupting a critical moment. Bob's expression darkens at the news, hinting at underlying tensions, and Jeep walks toward the gas pumps, with Bob right alongside him, not giving up. Jeep stiffens, turns to his father, and Bob gives him a hard stare filled with unspoken words. Jeep looks at his father, his words hanging heavily in the air as if solidifying an unbreakable bond or foreboding future actions. Bob then walks back into the diner, the doorway framing his retreat. Jeep is about to return to the garage, an echo of past conflicts resolved, when he notices ominous dark clouds on the southern horizon like a living wall, a harbinger of potential storms both literal and metaphorical.

test_cases.description: Next to a faded diorama of the nativity scene a man deftly rolls an engraved silver Zippo back and forth over his nicotinestained fingers. Behind the counter Percy Walker a black man in his sixties is cooking with spectacular onehanded dexterity. A stunning sixteenyearold girl with dyedblack hair and a piercing or three leans seductively over the jukebox swaying gently to the music. Her headband doubling as a miniskirt reveals her knockout figure leaving little to the imagination. Watching from a booth across the diner is a conservatively dressed suburban couple Sandra and Howard Anderson. The girl Audrey Anderson turns to Howard with a caustic smile and then returns to the jukebox. while Percy discreetly watches the exchange from behind the counter. Howard turns back to his wife with a rigid smile. Outside the noontime sun bakes the highway slicing through the barren country as a black Cadillac. Escalade blazes a path heavy beats thundering from within. Kyle Williams handsome and in his late twenties with a thug style passes a weathered road sign and his expression suggests this is not good news. He grabs a cell phone from the passenger seat and spots a truck stop diner up ahead. The Escalade pulls off the highway to the old gas pumps. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. Kyle gets out surveying the grease stains and rusty car parts littering the ground and behind the place the Silverstream trailer is visible where Jeep was earlier. Kyle grabs a crumpled handdrawn map from the front seat and flattens it on the car roof. A woman let us out a long slow exhale considers. Kyle then pulls out a cigarette lights it off the end of hers and hands it to him. Kyle takes a drag and pulls out his map again. Charlie quickly hides her cigarette behind her back as Jeep nods uncertainly eyes. Kyle then shuffles away out of sight. Bob steps off a chair turns to Kyle about to respond. when Howard approaches unaware he is interrupting. Bob's expression darkens at the news and Jeep walks toward the gas pumps with Bob right alongside him not giving up. Jeep stiffens turns to his father and Bob gives him a hard stare. Jeep looks at his father his words hanging heavily in the air. Bob then walks back into the diner. Jeep is about to return to the garage when he notices ominous dark clouds on the southern horizon like a living wall.

test_cases.name: Subject Corruption
test_cases.description: Next to a faded diorama of the nativity scene, a squirrel deftly rolls an engraved silver Zippo back and forth over its nicotine-stained fingers. Behind the counter, Jessica Thompson, a white woman in her sixties, is cooking with spectacular one-handed dexterity. A stunning sixteen-year-old boy with dyed-black hair and a piercing or three leans seductively over the jukebox, swaying gently to the music. His headband, doubling as a mini-skirt, reveals his knock-out figure, leaving little to the imagination. Watching from a booth across the diner is a conservatively dressed suburban couple, Michael and Lisa Thompson. The boy, Brian Thompson, turns to Lisa with a caustic smile and then returns to the jukebox, while Jessica discreetly watches the exchange from behind the counter. Lisa turns back to her husband with a rigid smile. Outside, the noontime sun bakes the highway slicing through the barren country as a yellow school bus blazes a path, heavy beats thundering from within. Linda Jackson, elegant and in her late twenties with a bohemian style, passes a weathered road sign and her expression suggests this is not good news. She grabs a cell phone from the passenger seat and spots a truck stop diner up ahead. The school bus pulls off the highway to the old gas pumps. Linda gets out, surveying the grease stains and rusty car parts littering the ground, and behind the place, the Silverstream trailer is visible where Wolf was earlier. Linda grabs a crumpled hand-drawn map from the front seat and flattens it on the car roof. A parrot lets out a long slow exhale, considers Linda, then pulls out a cigarette, lights it off the end of his, and hands it to her. Linda takes a drag and pulls out her map again. Emily quickly hides her cigarette behind her back as Wolf nods uncertainly, eyes Linda, then shuffles away out of sight. Rupert steps off a chair, turns to Linda, about to respond when Lisa approaches, unaware she's interrupting. Rupert's expression darkens at the news, and Wolf walks toward the gas pumps, with Rupert right alongside him, not giving up. Wolf stiffens, turns to his friend, and Rupert gives him a hard stare. Wolf looks at his friend, his words hanging heavily in the air. Rupert then walks back into the diner. Wolf is about to return to the garage when he notices ominous dark clouds on the southern horizon like a living wall.

test_cases.name: Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Next to a faded mural of a seaside picnic, a man deftly rolls an engraved bronze compass back and forth over his turmeric-stained fingers. Behind the counter, Percy Walker, a black man in his sixties, is cooking with spectacular one-handed dexterity. A stunning sixteen-year-old girl with dyed-purple hair and a piercing or three leans seductively over the pinball machine, swaying gently to the music. Her scarf, doubling as a mini-skirt, reveals her knock-out figure, leaving little to the imagination. Watching from a booth across the café is a conservatively dressed suburban couple, Sandra and Howard Anderson. The girl, Audrey Anderson, turns to Howard with a caustic smile and then returns to the pinball machine, while Percy discreetly watches the exchange from behind the counter. Howard turns back to his wife with a rigid smile. Outside, the noontime sun bakes the railway tracks slicing through the barren country as a black Mustang rumbles a path, heavy beats thundering from within. Kyle Williams, handsome and in his late twenties with a thug style, passes a weathered billboard and his expression suggests this is not good news. He grabs a walkie-talkie from the passenger seat and spots a truck stop café up ahead. The Mustang pulls off the railway to the old water pumps. Kyle gets out, surveying the grease stains and rusty bicycle parts littering the ground, and behind the place, the tour bus is visible where Jeep was earlier. Kyle grabs a crumpled hand-drawn blueprint from the front seat and flattens it on the car roof. A woman lets out a long slow exhale, considers Kyle, then pulls out a matchstick, lights it off the end of hers, and hands it to him. Kyle takes a drag and pulls out his blueprint again. Charlie quickly hides her matchstick behind her back as Jeep nods uncertainly, eyes Kyle, then shuffles away out of sight. Bob steps off a ladder, turns to Kyle, about to respond when Howard approaches, unaware he's interrupting. Bob's expression darkens at the news, and Jeep walks toward the water pumps, with Bob right alongside him, not giving up. Jeep stiffens, turns to his father, and Bob gives him a hard stare. Jeep looks at his father, his words hanging heavily in the air. Bob then walks back into the café. Jeep is about to return to the garage when he notices ominous dark clouds on the northern horizon like a living wall.

test_cases.name: Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Next to a faded diorama of the nativity scene, a man nimbly flips an engraved silver Zippo over his nicotine-stained fingers. Behind the counter, Percy Walker, a black man in his sixties, is dancing with spectacular one-handed flair. A stunning sixteen-year-old girl with dyed-black hair and a piercing or three crouches playfully over the jukebox, spinning gently to the music. Her headband, doubling as a mini-skirt, reveals her knock-out figure, leaving little to the imagination. Watching from a booth across the diner is a conservatively dressed suburban couple, Sandra and Howard Anderson. The girl, Audrey Anderson, glances at Howard with a caustic smile and then hops back to the jukebox, while Percy silently observes the exchange from behind the counter. Howard glances back at his wife with a rigid smile. Outside, the noontime sun smothers the highway slicing through the barren country as a black Cadillac Escalade cruises a path, heavy beats pulsing from within. Kyle Williams, handsome and in his late twenties with a thug style, drives past a weathered road sign and his expression conveys this is not good news. He snatches a cell phone from the passenger seat and notices a truck stop diner up ahead. The Escalade veers off the highway to the old gas pumps. Kyle steps out, scanning the grease stains and rusty car parts scattered across the ground, and behind the place, the Silverstream trailer is visible where Jeep was earlier. Kyle retrieves a crumpled hand-drawn map from the front seat and presses it flat on the car roof. A woman lets out a long slow chuckle, observes Kyle, then pulls out a cigarette, ignites it off the end of hers, and hands it to him. Kyle inhales and retrieves his map again. Charlie swiftly hides her cigarette behind her back as Jeep nods uncertainly, watches Kyle, then drifts away out of sight. Bob climbs down from a chair, turns to Kyle, about to gesture when Howard approaches, oblivious he's intruding. Bob's expression clouds at the news, and Jeep strides toward the gas pumps, with Bob right beside him, not relenting. Jeep freezes, faces his father, and Bob gives him a hard glare. Jeep gazes at his father, his words hanging heavily in the air. Bob then saunters back into the diner. Jeep is about to wander back to the garage when he notices ominous dark clouds on the southern horizon like a living wall.

test_cases.name: Subject-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Next to a tattered sandcastle of the medieval tournament, a penguin deftly rolls an embroidered copper thimble back and forth over its ink-stained flippers. Behind the easel, Gerald Smith, a green lizard in its forties, is sketching with spectacular one-legged skill. A dazzling two-year-old panda with bleached-blond fur and a pattern or three leans gracefully over the boombox, swaying harmoniously to the rhythm. Its bracelet, doubling as a tie, reveals its stunning shape, leaving much to the imagination. Observing from a hammock across the gallery is a flamboyantly dressed alien duo, Clara and Dennis O’Neil. The panda, Max O’Neil, turns to Dennis with a sardonic grin and then returns to the boombox, while Gerald discreetly observes the interaction from behind the easel. Dennis turns back to his partner with an awkward grin. Inside, the midnight moon brightens the river meandering through the lush forest as a white Volkswagen Beetle glides a path, soft jazz humming from within. Chris Johnson, charming and in their early thirties with a bohemian flair, passes a shiny streetlight and their expression suggests this is excellent news. They grab a notepad from the driver’s seat and spot a playground pavilion up ahead. The Beetle pulls into the meadow beside the ancient trees. Chris gets out, examining the flower petals and dusty toys scattered around, and beyond the area, the steel gazebo is visible where Scooter was earlier. Chris pulls a folded blueprint from the dashboard and smooths it on the tree stump. A deer lets out a gentle sigh, regards Chris, then picks up a daisy, smells it, and tosses it to them. Chris inhales deeply and retrieves the blueprint again. Jamie quickly hides the daisy behind its antlers as Scooter nods hesitantly, eyes Chris, then trots quietly out of view. Sam steps off a ladder, turns to Chris, about to reply when Dennis arrives, unaware they’re intruding. Sam’s expression tightens at the update, and Scooter walks toward the flowerbeds, with Sam right beside it, not backing down. Scooter freezes, turns to its sibling, and Sam gives it a piercing glance. Scooter looks at its sibling, its words held heavily in the silence. Sam then strolls back into the gallery. Scooter is about to return to the orchard when it notices foreboding vivid rainbows on the northern skyline like a vibrant tapestry.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Next to a faded display of the nativity scene, a cat nimbly flips an engraved silver Zippo back and forth over its nicotine-stained paws. Behind the counter, Ethan Jones, a leopard in his sixties, is sketching with spectacular one-pawed dexterity. A breathtaking sixteen-year-old kangaroo with dyed-black fur and a piercing or three leans seductively over the jukebox, nodding gently to the music. Its bandana, doubling as a mini-skirt, reveals its knock-out figure, leaving little to the imagination. Observing from a booth across the diner is a conservatively dressed suburban lion couple, Lisa and Mark Smith. The kangaroo, Tammy Smith, turns to Mark with a biting grin and then returns to the jukebox, while Ethan discreetly observes the exchange from behind the counter. Mark turns back to his wife with a stiff grin. Outside, the noontime sun scorches the highway slicing through the barren landscape as a white Porsche Cayenne streaks a path, heavy rock thundering from within. Brian Johnson, charming and in his late thirties with a punk style, passes a worn road sign and his face suggests this is not good news. He grabs a newspaper from the passenger seat and notices a truck stop diner up ahead. The Cayenne veers off the highway to the old gas pumps. Brian gets out, inspecting the grease spots and rusty metal parts scattered on the ground, and behind the place, the Silverstream trailer is visible where Leo was earlier. Brian grabs a crumpled hand-drawn map from the front seat and smooths it on the car hood. A cheetah lets out a long slow hiss, watches Brian, then pulls out a snack, shares it off the edge of hers, and hands it to him. Brian takes a bite and retrieves his map again. Alex quickly hides her snack behind her back as Leo nods uncertainly, eyes Brian, then slides away out of sight. Zach steps off a ladder, turns to Brian, about to speak when Mark approaches, unaware he's interrupting. Zach's expression darkens at the news, and Leo strolls toward the gas pumps, with Zach right alongside him, not backing down. Leo stiffens, turns to his father, and Zach gives him a hard glare. Leo looks at his father, his silence hanging heavily in the air. Zach then strides back into the diner. Leo is about to return to the garage when he notices ominous dark shapes on the southern horizon like a moving barrier.

test_cases.name: Object-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Next to a worn billboard of the autumn festival, a man skillfully flips a polished brass compass over his ink-stained fingers. Behind the counter, Percy Walker, a black man in his sixties, is knitting with impressive one-handed agility. A striking sixteen-year-old girl with bleached-blonde hair and a tattoo or three leans enticingly over the slot machine, bobbing slightly to the rhythm. Her bracelet, doubling as a scarf, emphasizes her knockout figure, leaving little to imagination. Observing from a booth across the eatery is a conservatively dressed suburban couple, Sandra and Howard Anderson. The girl, Audrey Anderson, turns to Howard with a sardonic grin and then returns to the slot machine, while Percy subtly observes the interaction from behind the counter. Howard turns back to his wife with a tense grin. Outside, the noontime sun melts the pathway cutting through the barren landscape as a black Cadillac Escalade roars past, heavy harmonies reverberating from within. Kyle Williams, dashing and in his late twenties with a rogue style, passes a weathered billboard and his demeanor suggests this is unwelcome news. He grabs a radio from the passenger seat and spots a roadside inn up ahead. The Escalade turns off the path to the vintage water pumps. Kyle climbs out, inspecting the oil blotches and rusted bicycle parts scattered on the ground, and behind the place, the caravan is visible where motorcycle was earlier. Kyle grabs a crumpled doodle from the front seat and smooths it on the car roof. A woman releases a quiet sigh, considers Kyle, then pulls out a whistle, blows it softly and hands it to him. Kyle takes a note and unfurls his doodle again. Charlie quickly conceals her whistle behind her back as Jeep nods unsurely, eyes Kyle, then ambles away out of sight. Bob steps off a crate, turns to Kyle, about to reply when Howard approaches, oblivious to the interruption. Bob’s expression sours at the update, and Jeep strides toward the water pumps, with Bob right beside him, not relenting. Jeep freezes, turns to his father, and Bob gives him a firm look. Jeep regards his father, his words lingering heavily in the air. Bob then strides back into the eatery. Jeep is about to return to the workshop when he notices threatening dark waves on the southern horizon like a moving wall.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Beside a worn-out sculpture of a circus act, a cat awkwardly tosses a polished glass marble around its dusty paws. Near the fountain, Oliver Johnson, a tall rabbit in his forties, is dancing with remarkable one-footed flair. An impressive thirty-year-old woman with electric-blue feathers and a bracelet or four leans cautiously over the candy machine, bouncing rhythmically to the silence. Her scarf, doubling as a poncho, uncovers her majestic plumage, leaving much to the imagination. Glancing from a bench next to the market is a brightly dressed rural duo, Linda and Robert Thompson. The woman, Wendy Thompson, glances at Robert with a gentle frown and then scans the candy machine, while Oliver subtly observes the interaction from beside the fountain. Robert turns back to his partner with a soft frown. Inside, the evening moon chills the footpath creeping through the dense forest as a white Volkswagen Beetle crawls a trail, soft melodies echoing from inside. Mark Johnson, brave and in his early forties with a knightly demeanor, bypasses a cracked billboard and his demeanor indicates this is joyous news. He retrieves a notebook from the rear perch and notices a marketplace tent up ahead. The Beetle veers onto the path to the ancient watering hole. Mark steps out, noting the oil streaks and polished bicycle parts adorning the ground, and beyond the area, the Golden Caravan steps into view where Tango was previously. Mark extracts a wrinkled blueprint from the side panel and smooths it on the vehicle hood. An owl lets out a brief fast hoot, inspects Mark, then pulls out a rope, ties it around itself, and hands it to him. Mark takes a swing and examines his blueprint again. Luna swiftly hides her rope beneath her wing as Tango nods nervously, eyes Mark, then tiptoes away out of view. Sam skips on a stool, turns to Mark, ready to discuss when Robert arrives, unknowingly he's intruding. Sam's face brightens at the announcement, and Tango strides toward the watering hole, with Sam right next to him, not letting go. Tango relaxes, turns to his elder, and Sam offers him a gentle nod. Tango gazes at his elder, his thoughts lingering lightly in the air. Sam then strolls back into the market. Tango is preparing to venture back to the workshop when he spots radiant bright stars on the northern skyline like a gentle sea.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Next to a faded nativity scene diorama, a man flips a silver Zippo over his stained fingers. Percy Walker, a skilled black chef in his sixties, cooks behind the counter while a stunning sixteen-year-old girl, Audrey Anderson, sways over the jukebox, taunting her parents, Sandra and Howard Anderson, who watch from a booth. Outside, Kyle Williams, a handsome man in his late twenties, drives a black Cadillac Escalade along the highway, reacting poorly to the sight of a weathered road sign. He stops at a diner and examines a crumpled map. A woman lights a cigarette and offers it to him, observing as Jeep, hiding his cigarette, warily eyes Kyle and leaves. Bob talks to Kyle until Howard interrupts, darkening Bob's expression. Bob confronts his son, Jeep, near the gas pumps, and Jeep tenses at his father's hard stare. As Bob returns to the diner, Jeep notices ominous dark clouds on the horizon.

from a booth across the diner is a conservatively dressed suburban couple Sandra and Howard Anderson The girl Audrey Anderson turns to Howard with a caustic smile and then returns to the jukebox while Percy discreetly watches the exchange from behind the counter Howard turns back to his wife with a rigid smile Outside the noontime sun bakes the highway slicing through the barren country as a black Cadillac Escalade blazes a path heavy beats thundering from within Kyle Williams handsome and in his late twenties with a thug style passes a weathered road sign and his expression suggests this is not good news He grabs a cell phone from the passenger seat and spots a truck stop diner up ahead The Escalade pulls off the highway to the old gas pumps Kyle gets out surveying the grease stains and rusty car parts littering the ground and behind the place the Silverstream trailer is visible where Jeep was earlier
